title: pr.probability - Upper bounding the sum with hypergeometric and binomial probabilities
body: Could you please help me upper bound this tricky expression: $$P(A)=\sum_{i=0}^n{\left( 1 - \dfrac{\binom kq \binom {n-k}{i-q}}{\binom {n}{i}} \right)}^I \binom ni p^i {(1-p)}^{n-i}$$ . So far I only managed to obtain a lower bound by proving $\sum_{i=0}^n{\dfrac{\binom kq \binom {n-k}{i-q}}{\binom {n}{i}}\binom ni p^i {(1-p)}^{n-i}}=\binom kq p^q {(1-p)}^{k-q}$ and applying Jensen's inequality for power function $f(x):=x^I$ . This lower bound is $P(A) \geq {\left(1-\binom kq p^q {(1-p)}^{k-q}\right)}^I$ and works okay for my needs. However, I would like to get a similar upper bound too and this is what causes the main difficulty.
